business.headline: NPS Vatsalya: 9,705 minors sign up on Day 1. Here's how to invest for your child?The scheme, overseen by the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA), is part of the National Pension System (NPS) and aims to help parents and guardians begin retirement savings for their children from an early age

PM Modi scans Paytm QR at Vishwakarma exhibition, highlights fintech's role for small merchantsPM Modi bought an artefact of Bhagwan Jagannath and paid via Paytm QR, showcasing not only the significance of the crafts but also the role of fintech in empowering small merchants and fostering increased trust in mobile payments.

Study shows people in US work 5 days to buy iPhone 16; how long do Indians need?A recent study reveals how long people in different countries need to work in order to afford the iPhone 16, with citizens in Switzerland requiring the least number of days.
No work, no pay: Samsung warns workers on strike in Chennai The strike, which began on September 9, 2024, involves hundreds of workers at Samsung's home appliances factory near Chennai.

Sensex ends 1,400 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; ICICI Bank jumps 5%At the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 1,381.99 points to 84,566.79, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 375.15 points to settle at 25,790.95.
Ashneer Grover shares why he quit EY in a day despite Rs 1 crore salaryIn an old video, Grover shares why he left Ernst & Young (EY) on his very first day despite being offered a Rs 1 crore salary.

Should you buy Vodafone Idea shares after 20% fall? UBS shares new target priceVodafone Idea shares fell 20% after the Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed the company's curative petition, which sought a re-computation of Adjusted Gross Revenue (AGR) dues.
Explained: Why IIFL Finance shares surged 13% todayIIFL Finance stock climbed to a high of Rs 560.60, marking its peak since late February, before settling to trade 9.31% higher as of 2:06 pm.
Explained: Why Cochin Shipyard shares soared 10% todayAt around 12:25 pm, shares of the company were up 9.45% at Rs 1,837.30 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Western Carriers IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusWestern Carriers IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status online via the BSE website or through Link Intime India Private Ltd.

iPhone 16 in 10 minutes: Quick commerce firms bring fight to Amazon, FlipkartiPhone 16 sales: Quick commerce platforms like Blinkit, BigBasket and Zepto have started delivering the latest iPhone 16 in minutes, challenging traditional e-commerce giants Amazon and Flipkart.
Sensex jumps over 1,276 points to cross 84,400, Nifty nears 25,800The S&P BSE Sensex was up 1275.45 points to 84,460.25 at 12:49 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 368.70 points to trade at 25,784.50.

Northern Arc IPO allotment: Latest GMP, step-by-step guide to check statusNorthern Arc IPO allotment: To check their share allocation, investors should visit the IPO registrar's portal or the BSE and NSE websites.

RITES shares rise 8% but why railway PSU stock may be showing 48% slideDespite this positive momentum, many investors were caught off guard, seeing what appeared to be a 48% slide in the stock price on their trading apps.
Elliott Hill's 32-year journey at Nike from intern to CEO goes viralElliott Hill, who has spent over 32 years at Nike, started his journey as an intern and will now be leading the iconic company.
Sensex surges 500 points, Nifty gains momentum; JSW Steel jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 415.45 points at 83,600.25 at 10:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 135.80 points to trade at 25,550.90.

Arkade Developers IPO allotment: Check status, GMP, subscription Arkade Developers IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status by logging into the BSE website or the Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd website, the issue's registrar.
Northern Arc Capital IPO allotment tomorrow: Check latest subscription, GMPNorthern Arc Capital Limited, founded in 2009, provides retail loans to underserved households and businesses across India.

Sensex, Nifty end higher after US Fed's 50 bps rate cut; NTPC gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 236.57 points higher at 83,184.80, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 38.25 points higher at 25,415.80. Both the indices had hit fresh all-time highs in early trade.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: PM leaves for 3-day US trip to participate in Quad Summit hosted by BidenThe fourth Quad Leaders' Summit will be hosted by President Joe Biden in his hometown of Wilmington in Delaware. The next Quad Summit will be hosted by India.

Amul denies supplying ghee to Tirupati temple amid 'animal fat in laddoo' rowIn a statement, Amul said that it prepares its ghee (clarified butter) from "high-quality pure milk fat" at its production facilities, adding that it never supplied ghee to Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanam (TTD).

Atishi to take oath as Delhi's youngest Chief Minister today with 5 ministers Atishi is set to become the third woman Chief Minister of Delhi, taking over from Arvind Kejriwal after the AAP chief stepped down from the post in a surprising move.

Fixed calendar for workplaces: Shashi Tharoor speaks to EY worker's fatherShashi Tharoor said he would propose legislation in Parliament for a fixed calendar to regulate working hours across all workplaces.

Kourtney Kardashian has a 'natural Ozempic' for weight loss. Is it a scam?Ozempic is a medication for Type 2 diabetes that helps control blood sugar, with the added side effect of weight loss. Socialite and reality TV personality Kourtney Kardashian has a natural alternative to Ozempic that she is going gaga over. What do doctors have to say?

BJP Mayor fakes blood donation during drive on PM's birthday, gets trolledBJP Mayor Vinod Agarwal said he went to the camp to donate blood but the doctor, when told that he was diabetic, said that he could not donate.

Hezbollah commander killed by Israel was wanted in 1983 US embassy blastOver 300 people were killed in the blasts. The US accused him of directing the abduction of American and German hostages in Lebanon and listed him as a Specially Designated Global Terrorist in 2019, putting a $7 million bounty on his head.

Yashasvi Jaiswal breaks Sunil Gavaskar's 51-year-old Test record India vs Bangladesh, Chennai Test: Yashasvi Jaiswal has now scored the most runs by an Indian batter after 10 Test matches, breaking the record previously held by the legendary Sunil Gavaskar. Jaiswal has scored 1,094 runs compared to Gavaskar's 978.

Tirupati laddoos row: Jagan Reddy says no violation by him, Centre seeks reportAt the Tirumala Venkateswara Temple in Andhra Pradesh, which sees an average daily footfall of over 60,000, laddoo is offered as prasadam. A recent lab report revealed the presence of animal fat in it, leading to a massive controversy.
Pune tanker flips, gets swallowed by caved-in road in Pune, video is viralThe truck was at the location for drainage cleaning work when a part of the ground gave way.

Rare polar bears shows up outside woman's house in Iceland, cops shoot it deadThe bear was killed Thursday afternoon in the northwest of Iceland after police consulted the Environment Agency, which declined to have the animal relocated, police told Associated Press.

Sana Khan wonders what is wrong with men who 'allow' wives to wear skimpy clothesSana Khan expressed disbelief at men who 'allow' their wives to wear skimpy clothes, claiming every man wants their wives to dress modestly.

Court strikes down IT Rules changes allowing Centre to set up Fact Check UnitsThe 'tie-breaker' judge of the Bombay High Court held that the amendments to the IT Rules violate rights under Article 14 and Article 19 of the Constitution of India.

AAP demands government accommodation for party chief Arvind KejriwalAAP leader Raghav Chaddha on Friday said that according to the rules laid down by the Election Commission of India, Arvind Kejriwal should be given government accommodation.

SRK-Preity Zinta's Veer Zaara enters Rs 100 crore club after re-releaseYash Chopra's timeless classic Veer-Zaara surpassed Rs 100 crore-mark at the worldwide box office upon its re-release, proving that it is just as loved by fans even 20 years later.

Tiny blue dot: You can see Neptune from India tonightFor observers in India, Neptune will be visible throughout most of the night on September 20-21, rising in the east just as the sun sets in the west.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

050507497 does not exist: When Israeli mobile bomb killed The Engineer in 1996Yahya Ayyash, popular as 'The Engineer', was Hamas's chief bombmaker whose devices had killed around 150 people. Spy agency Shin Beit used a cellphone bomb to kill Israel's most-wanted terrorist in 1996, when most of the world hadn't even seen a mobile. His killing in Gaza City came three decades before Hezbollah pager blasts in Lebanon.

900 Kuki militants entered Manipur from Myanmar, security agencies alertedAs per the intel alert, these are militants who are trained for the use of drone-based bombs, projectiles, missiles and jungle warfare.
Yudra Box Office Day 1: Highest opener for Siddhant ChaturvediYudhra, starring Siddhant Chaturvedi and Raghav Juyal, opened to Rs 4.50 crore. It became Chaturvedi's highest opener so far.
Fish looted at exhibition attended by Nitish Kumar in Bihar's Saharsa  There was huge chaos as people jumped into the biofloc tank and looted all the fish as soon as Nitish Kumar left the site.

Vairamuthu's veiled dig at singer amid #MeToo row: Should see a psychiatristSinger Suchitra, in an interview on a YouTube channel, stated that Vairamuthu made calls to singers and said there was "lust in their voice".

Karnataka temples asked to use only Nandini ghee amid Tirupati laddoo rowTemples in Karnataka have now been ordered to mandatorily use only Nandini ghee of the Karnataka Milk Federation (KMF) for making laddoos or any other type of sweets as offerings.

Watch: Aditya Roy Kapur flaunts new hairstyle, bearded lookAditya Roy Kapur was seen in Mumbai flaunting a new look. The actor, who wore a casual t-shirt and jeans, sported a new hairstyle and beard during his appearance on September 20.

Watch: Salman Khan returns to Mumbai after short Dubai tripBollywood superstar Salman Khan returned to Mumbai after his short visit to Dubai. The actor, surrounded by heavy security, was seen wearing a blue full-sleeved shirt with black pants, in full swag.

sports.headline: Sarandeep Singh appointed Delhi's Ranji coach, Gursharan new chief selectorFormer India off-spinner Sarandeep Singh has been appointed the head coach of Delhi's senior cricket team for the upcoming domestic season.

Ravindra Jadeja's batting has been an inspiration for me: Ravichandran AshwinIND vs BAN 1st Test: India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has revealed that he draws inspiration from Ravindra Jadeja's batting. The dup added 199 runs for the seventh wicket against Bangladesh.

Yashasvi Jaiswal breaks Sunil Gavaskar's 51-year-old Test record India vs Bangladesh, Chennai Test: Yashasvi Jaiswal has now scored the most runs by an Indian batter after 10 Test matches, breaking the record previously held by the legendary Sunil Gavaskar. Jaiswal has scored 1,094 runs compared to Gavaskar's 978.

Rishabh Pant attacks more than me: Adam Gilchrist praises India wicketkeeperFormer Australia cricketer Adam Gilchrist has showered massive praise on Rishabh Pant for his aggressive brand of cricket in Tests.

Manjrekar defends Kohli's dismal run in Tests: 'Better to get runs away'Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has defended Virat Kohli's poor run in Tests saying he likes to bat more outside India.

Fritz, Shelton draw Team World level with Europe with doubles victoryLaver Cup: Team World's Taylor Fritz and Ben Shelton defeated Team Europe's Carlos Alcaraz and Alexander Zverev, leveling the score at the end of the first day. The match saw the American duo dominate with 20 winners.

Gurbaz, Rashid Khan power Afghanistan to historic ODI series winAFG vs SA: Rahmanullah Gurbaz's century and Rashid Khan's five-wicket haul helped Afghanistan claim the ODI series with a 177-run win on Friday in Sharjah.

Pep Guardiola has changed world football: Wright-Phillips on City BossFormer Manchester City winger Shaun Wright-Phillips believes that the sides' present manager Pep Guardiola, has not only changed the system and the nature of football in the side or the Premier League, but also in the world aspect. Wright-Phillips believes that Guardiola's contribution to football has been truly phenomenal.

Malinga bana hua hain: Kohli's stump mic chatter with Shakib IND vs BAN: Virat Kohli and Shakib Al Hasan had a fun conversation on Day 3 of the Chennai Test. Kohli scored 17 runs before Mehidy Hasan Miraz dismissed him LBW.

Virat Kohli in splits after Rohit Sharma hits Shubman Gill on the jawThe Indian dugout was in splits after Rohit Sharma was caught hitting Shubman Gill on his jaw playfully during the Chennai Test match. Kohli, Rohit and Shubman shared a light moment as India dominated Bangladesh on Day 2 in Chennai.

Chennai Test: Bowlers' favourite Rohit Sharma at his tactical best on hot FridayIndia vs Bangladesh, 1st Test: On a scorching Friday in Chennai, Rohit Sharma rotated his bowlers well, making sure they bowled short and intense spells. India bundled out Bangladesh for 149 to take control of the series opener in Chennai.

Jadeja eyeing 300th Test wicket in Chennai Test after batting heroicsRavindra Jadeja sees India's Test series against Bangladesh as the perfect opportunity to reach his 300th Test wicket. With a stellar all-round performance already under his belt, Jadeja is just six wickets away from the milestone.

Wish I could be like him: Ravi Ashwin envious of Ravindra JadejaIND vs BAN: Ravi Ashwin heaped praise on Ravindra Jadeja after the latter troubled Bangladesh both with bat and ball in the first Test at the MA Chidambaram Stadium.

'Content' R Ashwin does not play cricket to answer critics anymoreIndia spinner R Ashwin has said that he is content with his cricket and does not play it to answer his critics anymore. Ashwin said that he had promised himself 5 years back that he would play the game with a smile on his face.

R Ashwin content with Test form after century vs BangladeshIndia spinner Ravichandran Ashwin scored his 6th Test century while playing against Bangladesh in Chennai. Ashwin said that he was content with his cricket at the moment as India sit on a 300+ lead after Day 2.

India are better with SG balls: Taskin Ahmed admits challenges IND vs BAN: Fast bowler Taskin Ahmed said that Bangladesh found it tough to counter the SC ball in their opening Test against India at the Chepauk.

Ashwin reveals build-up to heroic Chennai knock: Worked a lot on battingRavichandran Ashwin revealed that he had focused intensely on improving his batting ahead of India's first Test against Bangladesh. His 113-run knock, alongside Ravindra Jadeja's 86, rescued India from a top-order collapse in Chennai.

Kohli wanted to keep 3 reviews for his team: Manjrekar on Chennai Test LBWSanjay Manjrekar expressed sympathy for Virat Kohli's unfortunate LBW dismissal during India's Chennai Test against Bangladesh, noting that Kohli, unsure about the delivery, chose not to use the DRS to save it for his teammates.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
